body: \text{Evaluate } \int \frac{x^3}{\sqrt{1 - x^2}} \, dx.
\text{Find the value of } \int e^{2x} \sin(3x) \, dx.
\text{Compute } \int \frac{\ln x}{x^2} \, dx.
\text{Determine } \int \tan^{-1}(x) \, dx.
\text{Evaluate } \int \frac{x^2 + 2x + 1}{(x+1)^2} \, dx.
\text{Calculate the magnetic field at the center of a circular coil with 100 turns, each with a radius of 8.0 cm, carrying a current of 0.4 A.}
\text{Find the magnetic force per unit length on a wire carrying a current of 8 A at an angle of } 30^\circ \text{ to a uniform magnetic field of } 0.15 \, T.
\text{Determine the radius of the circular orbit for an electron moving at } 4.8 \times 10^6 \, \text{m/s perpendicular to a magnetic field of } 6.5 \times 10^{-4} \, T.
\text{Calculate the torque on a 10 cm square coil with 20 turns carrying 12 A, placed at } 30^\circ \text{ to a } 0.8 \, T \text{ magnetic field.}
\text{A solenoid 80 cm long with 5 layers of 400 turns each carries 8 A. Calculate the magnetic field at its center.}
\text{Two parallel wires, 4 cm apart, carry 8 A and 5 A currents in the same direction. Find the force on a 10 cm segment of one wire.}
\text{What is the magnitude of the magnetic force on a 3 cm wire segment carrying 10 A in a } 0.27 \, T \text{ magnetic field perpendicular to the solenoid's axis?}
\text{An electron enters a } 0.5 \, T \text{ magnetic field at } 45^\circ \text{ to its direction with velocity } 5 \times 10^6 \, \text{m/s. Calculate the magnetic force.}
\text{Find the magnetic field at a point 2 m from a long, straight conductor carrying 10 A current.}

\text{A current-carrying conductor is placed at right angles to a magnetic field. If the length of the conductor is 0.5 m, current is 2 A, and magnetic field is 0.4 T, calculate the force on the conductor.}
\text{Calculate the rms current for a 100 W resistor connected to a 220 V, 50 Hz AC supply.}
\text{The peak voltage of an AC supply is 300 V. What is the rms voltage?}
\text{A 44 mH inductor is connected to a 220 V, 50 Hz AC supply. Determine the rms current in the circuit.}
\text{Calculate the power factor of a series RLC circuit where } R = 100 \, \Omega, \; X_L = 200 \, \Omega, \text{ and } X_C = 150 \, \Omega.
\text{Determine the resonant frequency of an RLC series circuit with } L = 1 \, \text{mH} \text{ and } C = 1 \, \mu\text{F}.
\text{A capacitor of 10 } \mu\text{F} \text{ is connected to a 220 V, 50 Hz AC supply. Calculate the capacitive reactance and current in the circuit.}
\text{An inductor of 50 mH is connected to an AC supply of 120 V and 60 Hz. Find the inductive reactance and the rms current.}
\text{For a series RLC circuit with } R = 50 \, \Omega, \; L = 0.1 \, \text{H}, \text{ and } C = 10 \, \mu\text{F}, \text{ calculate the impedance at resonance.}
\text{Calculate the power consumed by a 40 } \Omega \text{ resistor in a 220 V, 50 Hz AC circuit.}
\text{Determine the effective voltage for an AC supply with a peak voltage of 440 V.}
